channel.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
channel.description:
I just started physics grade 11 this year, and I have an assignment: A biography on a physicist. I was thinking about going to the hod to try and get out of it, I just thaught I would get some opinions incase I am wrong and look like an idiot.
Is it just me or is that completely irrelivent? The study of physics, is basically how things work. Now a biography is a test on research and english skills. The assignment testing my english, not my physics knowledge.
One might argue that the point is that I learn about physics accomplishments, but they would be wrong. ;)
It is a biography, so I basically say "born then, grew up this way, invented this this and this, died then" in 3000 words. I learn nothing of physics.

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Thats really not a stupid project. We actually had to build stuff for my physics projects, and I clocked in over 40 hours on these projects over the past semester, and counting. We build ridiculously tedious projects which have nothing to do with physics. So consider yourself lucky.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Wildfire, post:8, topic:60552”]I can wait for Physics if they try to pull this crap…But…BobDole81, you own a Moparscape server or two? [quote=BobDole81]There’s a book called “On the Shoulders of Giants” COMPILED by Stephen Hawking…[/quote][/quote]A compilation of works is also called a collection…just as in an anthology you would find compiled together many short stories and plays, Stephen Hawking compiled the papers and portions of books of many physicists into a single volume.

And also, I don’t own any moparscape servers

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

UMMM a bibliography is this…

Bell, Stewart. The Martyr’s Oath: The Apprenticeship of a Homegrown Terrorist.
Mississauga, ON: Wiley, 2005.

Biale, David, ed. Cultures of the Jews: A New History. New York: Schocken, 2002.

Bowker, Michael. Fatal Deception: The Untold Story of Asbestos: Why It Is Still Legal
and Still Killing Us. N.p.: Rodale, 2003.

so that would be easy…
a biography is something differnt.

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Wildfire, that was a really idiotic comment since almost all programming languages need to be compiled. Moparscape is coded in Java, and therefore has to be compiled.
Anyway, BobDole meant compiled as in assembled, put together. (I presume you knew that)

Back to the topic, yeah, I think that is a waste of time Why not study the accomplishments of the physicists? =/ But maybe the teacher wants you to study his life so you can get an understanding of where his ideas came from?

Read full topic
item.source: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

I can wait for Physics if they try to pull this crap…But…BobDole81, you own a Moparscape server or two?

There’s a book called “On the Shoulders of Giants” COMPILED by Stephen Hawking…

item.source: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

There’s a book called “On the Shoulders of Giants” compiled by Stephen Hawking…it’s basically a collection of the works with biographical commentaries of some of the greatest physicists of the age of modern science. That may be worth going through (if you can find it at your library) to find a physicist whose work/life you find interesting if you haven’t already.

I guess if you’re just interested in actual quantitative physics, learning the history of it is not satisfying…I really have an interested in learning about the old, famous mathematicians and physicists, but that’s just me. You don’t really learn concepts or how to work out problems, but you gain a sense of how people were able to come up with such amazing theories and how they were able to apply the knowledge of their time to advance scientific knowledge…that is worth something if you go to work in that field.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Mopman:

Oh, I assumed “their accomplishments and how that affects today” was what you were doing. A straight-forward biography is quite useless, I agree.

A good biography would include those things.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Feuds work would not be useless, but a bibliography on Feud would be.

If I were to take a well known physicist, research his/her accomplishments and report about how it affects todays physics, then yes I would think that is relevent. However where he grew up, what his favourite food is etc, is not.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?

item.title: Does anybody else think this physics assignment is stupid?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The history of a subject is still part of the subject.

That’s like saying learning about Freuds life and work is useless in Psychology.

Read full topic
